p.s: I am happy to hear from you again!
How are you?
How is school doing?
In your last message you have asked me about our school project KLS goes green.
You know my school is KLS and goes green is obvious, isn't it?
I'm just kidding.
The day KLS goes green was an obligated day for all students full of workshops about our environment and how we can change our way of living to reach a sustainable life.
As a student we could choose between 40 different workshop refeeringreferring to different subjects like food, the use of water or second-hand clothing.
Have you heard about the world-wide movement Fridays for Future?
I'm sure you did.
Many student from our school - I was their sometimes too - visited the demonstrations of the movement.
As a result our leading students tried to bring the consciousness for our environment to our school.
In cooperation with the teachers they have created this day called KLS goes green.
In my opinion they really did a great job.
Some of the workshops fokussedfocussed on improving the sustainability of our school.
The students for example tried to find a way to make our shop in school more sustainable with fair and healthy produced products.
Other students made cupcakes without using products from animals.
They tried to show how tasteful a diet without these products and a living a sustainable life can be.
As a highlight of the day two rapper visited our school showing students how to use our voice.
With that knowledge we are able to learly communicate in a discussion.
Something that is quiet usefulluseful, don't you think?
All in all I can say that I really like the idea of the day KLS goes green.
On the day itself two years ago I was sick and needed to stay home.
I'm sad that I couldn't take part of this project but I'm looking forward to the next day of the idea to help students creating their own sustainable life.
I hope I have helped you to understand the day we call KLS goes green.
I looking forward to your respondresponse!
